Bases: ABC, Generic[GraphVertex]

Base abstract edge.

Parameters:

  • measurements – measurements which formed the edge.

  • factor – GTSAM factor.

  • noise_model – GTSAM noise model of the factor.

property index: int

Unique index of the edge.

Corresponds to the index of the factor in the factor graph.

Vertices of the edge.

class moduslam.frontend_manager.graph.base_edges.MultiEdge(vertex_set_1: set[GraphVertex], vertex_set_2: set[GraphVertex], measurements: tuple[Measurement, ...], factor: Factor, noise_model: Base)[source]

Bases: Edge

Base class for all multi-edges in the Graph. Multi-edge connects two sets of vertices.

  • vertex_set_2 – second set of vertices.

  • factor – GTSAM factor.

  • noise_model – GTSAM noise model of the factor.

Bases: Vertex

Base abstract non-optimizable vertex: does not have GTSAM properties and is not included in GTSAM factor graph as a variable.

class moduslam.frontend_manager.graph.base_vertices.OptimizableVertex(index: int = 0, timestamp: int = 0, value: Any = None)[source]

Bases: Vertex

Base abstract optimizable vertex of the Graph with GTSAM properties and is included in GTSAM factor graph as a variable.

GTSAM instance of the vertex.

TODO: add update for non-optimizable vertices.

marginalize(vertices: Iterable[GraphVertex]) → None[source]

Marginalizes out vertices.

Not implemented.

_set_index() → int[source]

Sets unique index for the new edge base on the size of the factor graph. Gtsam factor graph sets index to the factor by exploiting the size of the factor graph. This guarantees the uniqueness of the index. However, the size of the factor graph is not equal to the number of factors in the graph, because the factor graph may contain empty slots (null ptr objects). When the factor is removed, the size of the factor graph does not change. To reduce the size of the factor graph, the resize() method should be called.

Returns:

unique index.

_get_unique_gtsam_vertices()[source]

Gets vertices with unique gtsam indices.

Returns:

dict of indices and vertices.

moduslam.frontend_manager.graph.index_generator module

class moduslam.frontend_manager.graph.index_generator.IndexStorage[source]

Bases: object

Storage of unique indices.

If the storage is empty, min_idx = float(+inf) and max_idx = float(-inf)

Number of indices in the storage.

property min_idx: int

Minimum index in the storage.

property max_idx: int

Maximum index in the storage.

property indices: set[int]

Indices in the storage.

index – index to remove.

index – new index to update min and max indices.

moduslam.frontend_manager.graph.index_generator.generate_index(index_storage: IndexStorage) → int[source]
Generates new index for the given indices with the rule:

new index = max index + 1.

Parameters:

index_storage – storage of indices.

Returns:

new index.

find_closest_optimizable_vertex(vertex_type: type[GraphVertex], timestamp: int, margin: int) → GraphVertex | None[source]

Finds the closest optimizable vertex with the given timestamp, time margin and type. Start searching from the latest vertex to reduce complexity. Complexity: O(N).

TODO: Implement a more efficient search algorithm.

Add tests.

Parameters:

  • vertex_type – type of the vertex.

  • timestamp – timestamp of the vertex.

  • margin – time margin.

Returns:

vertex if found, None otherwise.
